experience: You and Sam both know Abe Pralle, Talbert Tso, and 5 others
You both studied at Northern Arizona University
You both studied at Northern Arizona University from 2007 to 2010

I deal daily with challenging issues in a live, time-critical environment on a distributed computing system. Without the luxury of hours-on-end in a development lab, I am accustomed to coming up with unique methods to quickly probe and resolve bugs when they arise.  I get to have a lot of fun solving complicated problems and constantly learning new aspects of an ever-changing, large-scale application.I daily have a positive impact on the effectiveness of the mission at the National Training Center. I have the special opportunity to support systems that help save lives, and have directly contributed to increasing the stability and up-time of our systems by 75%. I directly support and interact with over 200 users of the software I work with, and have an impact on thousands of other users worldwide. In this position, I:* have increased system stability and up-time by 75%* train new, incoming software engineers stationed at other Combat Training Centers* directly support and interact with over 300 users, and impact hundreds of other users worldwide* debug distributed applications in an operational environment* develop and debug across the full stack* assist in the gradual transition between software architectures* plan product update deployments and testing* guide the change management process for our systems* work as a remote member of a larger team* serve as the local site lead, directing the efforts of one other team member and interface directly with senior leadership of other contractsMy primary areas of expertise exposed in this role include:* SQL, Java, C# and C/C++* CORBA and REST and concepts related to distributed protocols and computing* Wildfly application server* Distributed systems debugging* General Microsoft Windows system administrative knowledge* SVN for source code control* Atlassian JIRA for bug tracking and tasking

In this position, I had the opportunity to support the mission at the National Training Center by focusing on cyber-security. I gained valuable insight into security control measures, auditing systems and how to identify and trace malicious activity in a large computing system.In this role, I:* Developed small scripts and applications to streamline work functions such as a vulnerability scan result aggregator which could track open vulnerabilities across multiple systems along with tracking any mitigating factors.* Assisted in DIACAP  security audits* Managed Nessus Security Center server and perform vulnerability scans* Performed all duties included in my former role as Jr. Computer Security Analyst

In this position, I had the opportunity to support the mission at the National Training Center by focusing on cyber-security. I gained valuable insight into security control measures, auditing systems and how to identify and trace malicious activity in a large computing system.In this role, I:* Developed a database tracking system to assist in managing the security audit status of various workstations and servers* Monitored servers and workstations for STIG compliance* Managed McAfee HBSS ePO server* Maintained hardware and software baseline documentation* Monitor audit logs for suspicious activitiy

I have the opportunity to pack bags filled with food for a full day which can be handed out to anyone in need. The bags are specially prepared with food items that do not require any cooking facilities and are easy to open and eat.

I am pleased to personally recommend Sam Mallon. Working with Sam over the past five years have allowed me to see his vast diversity of skills and talents.  He has been a great asset to the program here at the National Training Center serving as the local face of CPM. Sam’s detail in resolving system issues while always looking to provide enhancements and ever increasing the users experience. The IS Admins have greatly benefited from Sam’s skillset and knowledge.  He makes himself very available as well as a resource of knowledge for the System Admin team to reference. I feel one of the biggest asset that Sam possess is when any opportunity arises he will take the time to educate and explain.  Sam as a way of relaying complex matters into simple terminology making it easy for the users to understand. I personally can’t say enough how the System Admin team has shined on behalf of Sam’s tutelage. He takes great time in helping educate newer staff on a highly complex system.

Sam is among the few people I consider to be truly exceptional. In my time in the IT world I have met a great many people willing to take a problem at face value, and put a band-aid on it. Sam is not a "if the status light say's green that is good enough for me" kind of guy. He's the type of person that drills to the heart of a problem, to find the best solution possible. If everything is working: Can it work better? If a customer needs something to solve one problem: Is that REALLY the problem that needs to be solved? is that just a symptom? What will that problem look like 3 months from now? 6 months from now? Sam does not treat symptoms. Sam eradicates causes.I can honestly recommend Sam for any project thrown at him. My time working with him are some of the fondest I have in my professional career. He helped me become better at what I do, and I have zero doubts that any team he joins will rise to new levels with him involved.

Bill is a very hard worker and is extremely dedicated to the success of the mission he supports and the success of his team. He has done an excellent job of building a strong, knowledgeable, and capable team under his direction. He has exceptional technical knowledge in a vast array of systems ranging from Windows, Active Directory and other Microsoft knowledge, to Oracle database management, to VMWare virtual infrastructure management, to security policy auditing and beyond. The breadth of his knowledge and the depth of his experience make him an incredible member of any technical team, and has great leadership skills to offer. I am happy to have had the opportunity to work alongside Bill and not only achieve great results, but to have also learned a lot.
